In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the solution:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    # Lower case the column name
    col = lowercase(col)
    
    # Strip leading and trailing whitespaces
    col = strip(col)

    # Replace all spaces and hyphens with underscore
    col = replace(col, r"[ -]" => "_")

    return col
end
```
In the above function, the `lowercase` method is used to convert the string into lower case, `strip` removes leading or trailing whitespaces from a string, and `replace` method replaces all occurrences of spaces and hyphens with underscore in the given column name.
